utils

Class Timer

  • java.lang.Object
    • utils.Timer

  • public class Timer
extends java.lang.Object
    This utility class helps the game keep track of time. With this the game will know when it has to update and can calculate time differences.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static int FPS 
      private static long lastTime 
      private static double timePerTick 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Timer()

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean gameMustUpdate()
      Checks whether the game must update in order to achieve the desired frames per second as defined by @see FPS
      static long getFutureTime(double secondsFromNow)
      Gets a future time for Entities to know when to update.
      static boolean isItThatTimeYet(long timestamp)
      Checks whether the provided timestamp is now or in the past.
      static double secondsSince(long startTime)
      Calculates the amount of seconds elapsed since a given timestamp.

      • Timer

        public Timer()

    • Method Detail

      • gameMustUpdate

        public static boolean gameMustUpdate()
        Checks whether the game must update in order to achieve the desired frames per second as defined by @see FPS
        Returns:
        True if it's time to tick, False otherwise.

      • getFutureTime

        public static long getFutureTime(double secondsFromNow)
        Gets a future time for Entities to know when to update.
        Parameters:
        secondsFromNow - The number of seconds from now to mark.
        Returns:
        A timestamp in nanoseconds corresponding to the specified time.

      • isItThatTimeYet

        public static boolean isItThatTimeYet(long timestamp)
        Checks whether the provided timestamp is now or in the past.
        Parameters:
        timestamp - A timestamp in nanoseconds representing a moment.
        Returns:
        True if the system reports a time greater than or equal to the provided timestamp. False otherwise.

      • secondsSince

        public static double secondsSince(long startTime)
        Calculates the amount of seconds elapsed since a given timestamp.
        Parameters:
        startTime - The timestamp from when to start counting, in nanoseconds.
        Returns:
        The difference in seconds between now and the provided start time.
